title: Dear players who never want to take exhaust in off-support lanes.
body:
Just keep in mind for one moment how exhaust can be the choice between you winning or losing lane.

By this, I mean let's talk about assassins, burst mages, you know, scary champions? Yeah, exhaust turns their scariness to laughableness because look at this for a second:

Exhausts target enemy champion, reducing their Movement Speed and Attack Speed by 30%, their Armor and Magic Resist by 10, and **their damage dealt by 40% for 2.5 seconds.**

Like think about Annie, Syndra, Zed, time your shit right, and use that summoner's spell, BOOM, their burst just got destroyed, and they can't fight back, but guess whaaaaat? You can! You can kill them and snowball your lane! Isn't that AMAZING?

Seriously, I'm just saying, especially on immobile mages, exhaust can be insanely good because what it does is it instantly puts the enemy laner you're against at a disadvantage, and they'll probably flash from the movement slow because most of the time **they can't fight back.** Also, it makes it where you can completely turn the fight against someone, and snowball, like one time I was using Zyra against Annie, took exhaust, timed it well, she ulted when she got exhausted, boom, I spammed every ability possible, and she died, and I snowballed, and I carried my entire team to victory, and guess what? Annie, a really scary burst mage, was left in the dust, all because of that one summoner's spell.

So... if you're ever in a matchup against someone with high burst... think about taking exhaust... it might **really** make your time easier. :)
